title: Andrew Ranken: The Pogues Drummer Who Made Music
summary: Andrew Ranken, a drummer for the band The Pogues, has died at 72 years old. The band announced his death and said he was very important to them. He helped start the band in London and played on famous songs like Fairytale of New York. The Pogues called him the heartbeat of their group because he kept the rhythm with his drums. He also played other instruments like the harmonica and sang sometimes. The band shared a kind message thanking him for his friendship and music. They are thinking about his family during this sad time. Andrew Ranken was a founding member, meaning he was there from the beginning when the band formed in 1982. He played with other members like Shane MacGowan and Spider Stacy. His nickname was The Clobberer, and he made music that people loved.

background_read: The Pogues are a music band from London that started in 1982. They play a mix of punk rock and Irish folk music, which means fast, energetic songs with traditional sounds. Andrew Ranken was one of the first members and helped create their unique style. Bands often have drummers to keep the beat, and Ranken was important for making their music fun and lively. When someone in a band dies, it can be sad for fans and the other members, who might share memories to honor them.
